We have received a few questions and concerns regarding attendance during Distance Learning live sessions.

Our sole purpose for taking attendance is to offer support when it is needed. It is not tied to any sort of accountability or grade.

Transitioning from a traditional classroom setting will likely be a big adjustment for both children and families. Attendance patterns allow us to provide targeted support to students who need it to stay engaged. We are prepared to offer socioemotional support, more instructional guidance and intervention and more access to technology for students who need it.

For more information on the Distance Learning launch, please visit www.redlandsusd.net/rusdtoolkit.

October 22, 2018 at 5:32 PM · Redlands, CA ·

The Garner Holt AniMakerspace is the materialization of Redlands Unified School District’s multiyear vision plan - “RUSD 2025.” RUSD has targeted necessary resources and learning experiences to help close the achievement gap at Franklin Elementary. All students, TK through 5th grade, will be offered enhanced 21st century learning opportunities through the use of cutting-edge innovation and technology.

This innovation lab is the result of a collaborative partnership with local visionary Garner Holt and Garner Holt Productions. Mr. Holt is credited with the design and development of the animatronics in some of Disneyland Parks’ most famous attractions; among them, Pirates of the Caribbean, It’s A Small World, Haunted Mansion, Radiator Springs Racers and The Little Mermaid ~ Ariel’s Undersea Adventure.
